author: Tiffany Burnett

comment:
That lawyer is bullshitting. The law considers evidence in two ways: admissibility and relevance. The fact that a piece of evidence is admissibility does not make it relevant. Proving assault as in the case can only be done via either a flat out admission by JD or First hand evidence of events by witnesses or video/audio evidence that detail the events without ambiguity. 

Funny thing is Amber has no evidence at all to prove that JD assaulted her. And even the ones she has availed the public of her "bruises" have been shown to be demonstrably false.

 The most that these messages prove is that JD talks too much and was in a bad place. They go to no issue as far as the facts of proof of assault are concerned.

Another thing is, in court, all evidence has to frontloaded. That is all documents and evidence must be provided to the court at the beginning of the case. If Amber Heard really had evidence, we would have seen it already.
